alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chesterfield, north central Dinwiddie and southeastern Amelia Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mannboro, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sutherland around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Church Road, Five Forks, Walkers and Ammon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield
